bug.author: LeTristanB
bug.summary: Booleans are treated as numeric instead of categorical
bug.description: A column containing or will be summarized like a numeric column and trigger numeric warnings such as . Here's an example <denchmark-link:http://i.imgur.com/OaCPJ86.png>http://i.imgur.com/OaCPJ86.png</denchmark-link> . Boolean should be summarized like a categorial variable.

comments.comment: You're right, it does not make sense any other way. Thanks for catching. Feel free to update the code and send a pull request.

Hello, I've implemented a , see <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling/pull/64>#64</denchmark-link> . The implementation is close the categorical variable type, but I think it's useful to make the distinction between the two. For example, the stats is computed for boolean variables because it makes sense. df = pd.DataFrame({'Is it correct?':[True, True, False, True, True]}) pandas_profiling.ProfileReport(df) <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7131913/32264069-2a10e0f0-bedd-11e7-8135-f94dd0c2fe01.png></denchmark-link>
